main event: Multiple witnesses reported seeing a large, circular, disc-shaped object with a brilliant white color and a halo effect over Hawaii.
interesting points: The object appeared to grow several times larger than the full moon at its greatest size.
When directly over Hawaii, the object began to tumble or spin, creating a 'pinwheel effect' in the halo around it.
In addition to the main sighting, there were numerous other reports of lights in the sky that were deemed non-significant.
The sighting occurred shortly after a missile launch from Vandenberg AFB, which was initially considered as a possible cause.
The sighting was observed by both ground and airborne observers over a period of several minutes.
sighted object: a large, circular, disc-shaped object with a brilliant white color and a halo effect
photographs: yes, a photograph was obtained by the Baker-Nunn camera system on Sand Island, Johnston Island
